Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading Facebook post and a photo that has circulated since 2018 in Malaysian media reports.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo shows a Hong Kong police officer burnt after protesters threw petrol bombs at a police vehicle, without sufficient evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo has been circulating since 2018 in Malaysian media reports about a man who was attacked in Malaysia, not in Hong Kong.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by attributing the photo to the Hong Kong protests when it is not related to those events.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the photo is unrelated to the Hong Kong protests and actually depicts a man who was attacked in Malaysia in 2018.
